alert.note: Alert for Coos; Curry; Douglas; Josephine (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 03 at 9:20AM PST until December 05 at 7:09AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The coastal areas of Coos, Curry and Douglas counties, and far western Josephine County. * WHEN...Until 400 AM PST Monday. High tide around 4 PM today will increase coastal flooding potential. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, including Hunter Creek near Gold Beach and Highway 101 near Coos Bay and Bandon. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. Rock falls, including on Highway 38 and 241. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 914 AM PST, Emergency management reported minor flooding in the advisory area. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 4 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coos Bay, Brookings, Reedsport, Port Orford, North Bend, Coquille, Bandon, Myrtle Point, Lakeside, Powers, Sixes River Campground, Langlois, Edson Creek Campground, Bullards Beach State Park, Sixes, Cape Blanco State Park, Humbug Mountain State Park, Sunset Bay State Park, Charleston and Barview. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
